sections.name: Lightning Turtle
sections.text: Lightning turtles have a reputation as kind protectors of those lost or injured at sea. Their unique ability to promote healing by stimulating the body's natural bioelectricity has led to many attempts over the year to domesticate the creatures, but none have been successful.

sections.name: Galvanoscale
sections.text: An interesting characteristic among a number of Golarion's reptiles is their capacity to generate or manipulate electrical current. While there doesn't seem to be a single reason for this quality, enough species possess it for scholars to have created a category of reptiles known as galvanoscales.

traits.name: Animal
traits.text: An animal is a creature with a relatively low intelligence. It typically doesn’t have an Intelligence attribute modifier over –4, can’t speak languages, and can’t be trained in Intelligence-based skills.

interaction_abilities.name: Deep Breath
interaction_abilities.text: The lightning turtle can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

interaction_abilities.name: Greater Electrolocation
interaction_abilities.text: A lightning turtle can sense minute electrical charges in living creatures, which it can use as a precise sense at a range of 20 feet. This distance increases to 100 feet against any creature that has used an electricity effect within the last minute.

automatic_abilities.name: Shell Shock
automatic_abilities.trigger: A lightning turtle is hit by a melee or an unarmed attack
automatic_abilities.effect: The lightning turtle releases some of its stored electrical power, inflicting 7d6 electricity damage to the creature attacking it.

traits.name: Electricity
traits.text: Effects with this trait deal electricity damage. A creature with this trait has a connection to magical electricity.

traits.name: Nonlethal
traits.text: Attacks with this weapon are nonlethal, and are used to knock creatures unconscious instead of kill them. You can use a nonlethal weapon to make a lethal attack with a –2 circumstance penalty.

traits.name: Electricity
traits.text: Effects with this trait deal electricity damage. A creature with this trait has a connection to magical electricity.

traits.name: Electricity
traits.text: Effects with this trait deal electricity damage. A creature with this trait has a connection to magical electricity.

traits.name: Range
traits.text: These attacks will either list a finite range or a range increment, which follows the normal rules for range increments.

ability.name: Healing Pulse

traits.name: Electricity
traits.text: Effects with this trait deal electricity damage. A creature with this trait has a connection to magical electricity.

traits.name: Healing
traits.text: A healing effect restores a creature’s body, typically by restoring Hit Points, but sometimes by removing diseases or other debilitating effects.

traits.name: Primal
traits.text:
This magic comes from the primal tradition, connecting to the natural world and instinct. Anything with this trait is magical.  
  
A creature with this trait is primarily constituted of or has a strong connection to primal magic.

ability.text: The lightning turtle releases a pulse of low-intensity electricity from its body to promote healing. This restores 5d8 Hit Points to the turtle and each living ally within 10 feet, including creatures normally immune to electricity. The turtle can't use Healing Pulse again for 1 minute and is temporarily immune to the Healing Pulse of any lightning turtle for 1 minute.

ability.name: Sparking Shell
ability.text: The lightning turtle withdraws into its shell. This increases its AC to 36, but it can't act except to use Shell Shock or reemerge as a single action. While in its shell, the turtle's Shell Shock deals another 4d6 damage and loses the nonlethal trait.
